links: D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
formula: a(n) = 3*a(n-1) + a(n-2) - a(n-4) - a(n-5) - a(n-6) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
maple: PisotT := proc(a0,a1,n)    option remember;    if n = 0 then        a0 ;    elif n = 1 then        a1;    else        floor( procname(a0,a1,n-1)^2/procname(a0,a1,n-2)) ;    end if;end proc:A018920 := proc(n)    PisotT(3,10,n) ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 13 2016
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 3, a[1] == 10, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2] ]}, a, {n, 0, 30}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Txy:=[3,10]; [n le 2 select Txy[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)): n in [1..30]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016
crossrefs: See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _R. K. Guy_
